I think it would be redundant to add some of these asserts because if a forwarded class exists, an object will be created, otherwise, it returns null. What do you think?

OK then please check if the returned object is of right class. That is all; this is becasue of code changes in the future, we will be notified by the failing test. Otherwise, if we are just checking for "notNull", we will not be notified, test will nto fail and we might miss an important bug.
